subject: Data
title: Steel-Manning: Understanding the Other Side's Data
description: One-minute skill: Steel-Manning: Understanding the Other Side's Data.

hook.text: Instead of attacking the weakest version of an argument, what if you addressed the strongest?

buildup.text: Steel-manning means rebuilding your opponent's data argument in its strongest form before countering it.

discovery.text: It forces you to genuinely understand the other side's data â€” which often reveals legitimate points you missed.

twist.text: Most data debates are straw-man fights: both sides attack caricatures of the other's numbers.

climax.text: Steel-manning produces better analysis, more honest conclusions, and earns far more credibility.

punchline.text: Defeat the strongest argument, not the weakest straw man.

quiz.question: What does steel-manning an argument mean?
options: Addressing the strongest version of the opposing argument
